St Paul’s community centre transferred to ethical investment company
18 our of 24 libraries to be passed to volunteers will have buildings retained by council due to lack of public interest.
10 250-book collections including at leisure centres and churches.
£280k cut – 3 libraries to be passed to other councils, Libraries HQ to move into Lord Louis Library.
Vivacity libraries/arts/leisure trust to have £1.5m cut from council.
New central library announced as landmark of £50m town centre redevelopment.
Deep drop in numbers of users at seven volunteer-run libraries.
Considering outsourcing to become a Trust.
Hagley to be run by volunteers, with building and premises management costs paid for by parish council.

Sheffield – Business and IP Centre installed in Central Library. Ecclesfield, Frecheville, Gleadless, Greenhill, Jodanthorpe, Newfield Green, Stannington, Totley, Walkley and Upperthorpe now run by volunteers. Broomhill, Park, Southey and Woodhouse libraries staffed by volunteers with council covering costs and some paid support.
School Library Service to close, £325k cut.
Libraries will have reduced hours, including previously threatened Holderness Road.
South Scarle becomes first "small library depository" with 300 books, volunteer staffed.
Church Stretton Library to move from current site to one on Shrewsbury Road.
Thurrock – £500k cut, may include loss of mobile library service.
Library cuts revised: 5 (not 6) out of 10 libraries not be cut, survivors will have hours cut to 24 per week (was 25).

Libraries initially planned for closure taken over by various partnerships: Dinnington (taken over by parish council, moved to village hall), Fenham (now run by Your Homes Newcastle), Cruddas Park (now run by Your Homes Newcastle and Newcastle College), Denton (Newcastle College and Dyslexia North East), High Heaton (Newcastle College and Friends group), Jesmond (volunteers). Blakelaw (will close in current location), Newbiggin Hall, and Fawdon may close or be taken over this year.
Nottinghamshire – Bingham Library £720k refurbishment inc. moving in of children’s centre
Four libraries may be cut: Bob Lawrence Library (£150,000 per year), North Harrow Library (£115,000 per year), Rayners Lane Library (£115,000 per year) and Hatch End Library (£100,000 per year).
Trafford - 3 libraries to close (Bowfell, Davyhulme and Lostock) in £700k cut.
"Library Link" room opened at Ormsgill Nursery and Primary School.
Cuts in opening hours inc. Central Wednesday AM and Friday PM, other branches down to three or four days opening per week.
Monmouthshire – Libraries and one stop shops to merge: £300k cut.
Coventry – 17 libraries under threat.  All council services to be transferred into five hubs.
